item.title: Urgent cleaning is needed, 27th October
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping - Porthkerry Avenue, 27th October
item.description:

item.title: Abandoned and damaged Blue Ford near 11 Vicarage Park, 27th October
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle has been left for more than 2 or more months. Majority of windows smashed and huge amount of glass is scattered all around the pedestrian area. IMMENSE DANGER TO PEOPLE! The vehicle poses a huge hazard to residents especially young children. I will kindly request greenwich council to intervene and remove the car as soon as possible before any resident gets injured. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Vicarage Park, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flower stall stand moved, 27th October
item.description:
The flower stall that is next to crepe affair has moved their flower stand to opposite pedro lounge. Looks dumped. Apparently they were told by the council it canâ€™t stay (out of the way) next to crepe affaire. Why? When you allow 3 other market stalls that look ugly to remain in the centre of the high street? This stand should be moved back to crepe affaire where it was out of the way and looked after.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33 - 34, Market Square, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is no lighting on this bridge over new river, 27th October
item.description:
This footpath is used constantly by local residents including children coming back from Hazelwood school, runners and dog walkers in the park etc. As the evenings are getting dark it is dangerous to not have street lighting here. It is also clearly enabling flytippers and other criminality as you can clearly see from the amount of reports in this one small area. Investing in some lighting would reduce other problems as well and be a good long term investment for this area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bayswater Close, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mouldy old chest dumped on towpath at the bridge, 27th October
item.description:
There continues to be ongoing fly tipping in this area and the less the council does about it the more it will continue to happen. There is now this mouldy old chest dumped here along with a trolley, old office chair, and other things dumped into the actual river.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bayswater Close, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
